example_2: He is a member of the union.

definition_1: The way a word is used.
example_1: What is the correct use of this word?
example_2: This word has many uses.

example_1: I'm flying to Paris, via London.
example_2: I sent the message via email.

definition_1: A person who is hurt or killed.
example_1: He was the victim of a robbery.
example_2: The earthquake victims need help.

example_1: Can you warm the milk?
example_2: I need to warm my hands.

example_1: He knows his own strengths and weaknesses.
example_2: Chocolate is my weakness.

definition_1: To use something until it's broken.
example_1: I wore out my favorite shoes.
example_2: The long day wore me out.

definition_1: A report saying what the weather will be.
example_1: The weather forecast said it will rain.
example_2: I always check the weather forecast.

example_1: You need to weigh the risks.
example_2: I am weighing my options.

example_1: I had a weird dream last night.
example_2: That's a weird-looking hat.

example_1: You can do whatever you want.
example_2: Whatever you decide, I will support you.

example_1: "You're late!" "Who cares?"
example_2: Who cares what he thinks?

example_1: He is a wise old man.
example_2: That was a wise decision.

example_1: I need to wrap this present.
example_2: Wrap the food in foil.

definition_1: A formal way to end a letter.
example_1: (Used at the end of a formal letter).
example_2: I look forward to hearing from you. Yours sincerely, John.

example_1: He has a strong will; he never gives up.
example_2: It takes great will to quit smoking.
